perturbation.original_text: Article 79 Employees will be selected according to their professional qualifications, language abilities, individual characteristics and working experience. The specific number and qualifications of the Working Personnel shall be determined by the CEO in accordance with the operating needs of the Page 19 Joint Venture Company. All employees hired by the Joint Venture Company must complete satisfactorily a six-month probationary period of employment before they will be considered regular employees of the Joint Venture Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Article 79 Employees will be selected according to their professional qualifications, language abilities, individual characteristics and working experience. The specific number and qualifications of the Working Personnel shall be determined by the CEO in accordance with the operating needs of the Page 19 Joint Venture Company. All employees hired by the Joint Venture Company are immediately considered regular employees of the Joint Venture Company upon hiring.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the probationary period. The original text states a six-month probationary period is required before an employee is considered regular, while the modified version states that employees are immediately considered regular employees upon hiring. This creates uncertainty about the actual employment status and rights of new hires.

perturbation.original_text: Article 52 The Board of Directors shall comprise seven (7) directors, three (3) of whom shall be appointed by Party A and four (4) of whom shall be appointed by Party B. The chairman of the board shall be appointed by Party A, and its vice-chairman by Party B.
perturbation.changed_text: Article 52 The Board of Directors shall comprise seven (7) directors, three (3) of whom shall be appointed by Party A and four (4) of whom shall be appointed by Party B. The chairman of the board shall be appointed by Party B, and its vice-chairman by Party A.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the appointment of the chairman and vice-chairman. The original text states that the chairman is appointed by Party A and the vice-chairman by Party B, while the modified version reverses these roles. This creates uncertainty about which party has control over the board.

perturbation.original_text: Article 91 After the payment of income taxes by the Joint Venture Company, the Board of Directors will determine the annual allocations to each of the Three Funds from the after-tax net profits. The sum Page 21 of the allocations to the Three Funds for any fiscal year shall be determined by the Board and shall not exceed ten percent (10%) of the after-tax profit for that year so as to ensure the Joint Venture Company's smooth operation.
perturbation.changed_text: Article 91 After the payment of income taxes by the Joint Venture Company, the CEO will determine the annual allocations to each of the Three Funds from the after-tax net profits. The sum Page 21 of the allocations to the Three Funds for any fiscal year shall be determined by the CEO and shall not exceed twenty percent (20%) of the after-tax profit for that year so as to ensure the Joint Venture Company's attractive welfare.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces contradiction. In the original text, the Board of Directors determines the allocations to the Three Funds, with a maximum limit of 10% of after-tax profit. The changed text gives this authority to the CEO, and also increases the limit to 20%. This generates ambiguity as to who has the final say on fund allocation, and by how much they can be.
